Disclosure Topic: Transparent Information & Fair Advice for Customers
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to informing customers about products
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its approach to informing customers about its products, including the focus on transparency of the content, communication method, frequency of communication, and responsibility for communication.

Disclosure Topic: Transparent Information & Fair Advice for Customers
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to informing customers about products
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its policies and procedures related to the marketing and communication of information about its insurance products to customers.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of disclosure includes current as well as prospective customers.

Disclosure Topic: Transparent Information & Fair Advice for Customers
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to informing customers about products
Technical Protocol: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to, the communication of information regarding:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Suitability of insurance products (e.g., risk profile)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Cost structure of insurance products
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Terms of insurance coverage (e.g., limits, deductible)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: Scope of insurance coverage (e.g., what is covered by the policy)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 5: Any unique policy exclusions or exceptions (e.g., anti-concurrent causation clauses)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 6: Processes for payment of claims (e.g., role of adjuster, disputes, settlement)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 7: Availability of information throughout the customers‘ lifecycles (e.g., through online access)

Disclosure Topic: Transparent Information & Fair Advice for Customers
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to informing customers about products
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its communication processes.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Mechanisms used (e.g., direct mailing, online accounts, telephone hotlines)
• Responsible personnel involved (e.g., sales and marketing, adjusters)

Disclosure Topic: Transparent Information & Fair Advice for Customers
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to informing customers about products
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include the entity’s policies and procedures related to communication at any stage of customer‘s lifecycle, such as during the sale of a product or when a claim is filed.

Disclosure Topic: Transparent Information & Fair Advice for Customers
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to informing customers about products
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss the regulatory environment related to marketing and communication to customers the entity operates in.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to, marketing and communication policies and procedures the entity adopted as a result of regulatory compliance as well as policies and procedures the entity adopted voluntarily as the industry best practice.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Total invested assets, by industry and asset class
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the amount of its short-term and long-term investment assets by asset class.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of the disclosure includes:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Stock and bond investments reported on Schedule D
• Derivatives reported on Schedule DB
• Mortgage loans on real estate reported on Schedule B
• Real estate reported on schedule A

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Total invested assets, by industry and asset class
Technical Protocol: The entity shall break down its stock, bond, and derivative investments by industry.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The entity shall use the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) for classifying investees.
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• The entity shall use the NAICS 3 Digit Subsector code-level breakdown in its disclosure.
• The entity shall use the latest version of the NAICS available at the time of disclosure.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The entity shall disclose its exposure to at least the 10 largest industries by monetary amount of exposure, or to industries representing at least 2 percent of the overall portfolio monetary exposure.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Total invested assets, by industry and asset class
Technical Protocol: The entity may additionally breakdown the exposure by credit quality (investment-grade vs. noninvestment-grade).

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in its investment management processes and strategies.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The definition of incorporation of ESG factors is aligned with that of the Global Sustainable Investment Alliance (GSIA) and includes the use of ESG information in the investment decision-making processes.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Examples of ESG factors/issues are provided in the PRI Reporting Framework – Main definitions 2018, section “ESG issues.”
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Incorporation of ESG factors include the following approaches, consistent with the PRI Reporting Framework – Main definitions 2018:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 3:
• Screening, including a) negative/exclusionary, b) positive/best-in-class, and c) norms-based
• Sustainability themed investment, defined as investment in themes or assets specifically related to sustainability (for example clean energy, green technology or sustainable agriculture)
• Integration of ESG, defined as the systematic and explicit inclusion of material ESG factors into investment analysis and investment decisions
• A combination of the above

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: Where relevant, the entity shall discuss its approach to incorporation of ESG factors in selecting external fund managers and fiduciary managers.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The entity shall describe its oversight/accountability approach to assessing the quality of incorporation of ESG factors by external fund managers and fiduciary managers, which includes, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Formal oversight individuals and/or bodies involved
• Roles and responsibilities of employees involved
• Criteria used in assessing the quality of ESG incorporation

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: Where relevant, the description of the entity’s approach to incorporation of ESG factors in its investment management activities shall be broken down by asset class or by style employed.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The discussion shall include, but is not limited to, the differences in the entity’s approaches to incorporation of ESG factors in:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Public equity, fixed income, private equity, or alternative asset classes
• Passive versus active investment strategies
• Fundamental, quantitative, and technical analyses of investments

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe regulatory requirements it is subject to that limit the types of allowable investments the entity may make as well as allowable credit and equity risk the entity may be exposed to.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The description of the entity’s approach to incorporation of ESG factors in its investment management processes and strategies shall be provided in the context of the regulatory environment the entity is subject to.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe policies that determine its approach to incorporation of ESG factors in its investment management processes and strategies.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its approach to implementation of the aspects of the entity’s ESG incorporation practices.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Parties responsible for day-to-day incorporation of ESG factors
• Roles and responsibilities of employees involved
• Approach to conducting ESG-related research
• Approach to incorporating ESG factors into investment strategies

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its oversight/accountability approach to the incorporation of ESG factors.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Formal oversight individuals and/or bodies involved
• Roles and responsibilities of employees involved
• Criteria used in assessing the quality of ESG incorporation

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss whether it conducts scenario analysis and/or modeling in which the risk profile of future ESG factors at the portfolio level is calculated.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: ESG factors include, but are not limited to, climate change, natural resource constraints, human capital risks and opportunities, and cybersecurity risks.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss ESG factors that it views as broadly applicable in terms of their impact on sectors and industries as well as the factors it views as sector- or industry-specific.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe whether it incorporates ESG factors in strategic asset allocation and/or allocation of assets between sectors or geographic markets.

Disclosure Topic: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management
Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment management processes and strategies
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe how ESG factors are incorporated into the assessment of and influence the entity’s perspectives on:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Time horizon of investments
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Risk and return profiles of investments
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Traditional fundamental factors such as economic conditions, Federal Reserve policy, industry factors, and geopolitical risks

Disclosure Topic: Policies Designed to Incentivize Responsible Behavior
Accounting Metric: Net premiums written related to energy efficiency and low carbon technology
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the net premiums written for policies related to energy efficiency and low carbon technology, including renewable energy insurance, energy savings warranties, and carbon capture and storage insurance).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of disclosure includes policies that can be demonstrated to absorb environmental risks, thereby enabling sustainability-related projects, technologies, and activities.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Renewable energy insurance may range from specialized protection against natural hazards or mechanical breakdowns to insurance against fluctuations in the availability of wind or solar radiation.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Energy savings warranties insure the energy savings guaranteed by Energy Services Companies (ESCOs) for building retrofitting and other energy efficiency projects.

Disclosure Topic: Policies Designed to Incentivize Responsible Behavior
Accounting Metric: Net premiums written related to energy efficiency and low carbon technology
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include policies where the insurer has separately priced and identified such net premiums in its billing to the customer.

Disclosure Topic: Policies Designed to Incentivize Responsible Behavior
Accounting Metric: Discussion of products and/or product features that incentivize health, safety, and/or environmentally responsible actions and/or behaviors
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe how it incentivizes health, safety, and/or environmentally responsible actions or behaviors through incorporation of clauses in the insurance policies sold to clients and through pricing structure of the policies.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of disclosure includes policies underwritten in the Property & Casualty (P&C) and Life segments and excludes Health Insurance policies.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The scope of disclosure includes the consumer insurance segment and the commercial insurance segment:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 2:
• The consumer segment includes homeowners, automotive, supplemental health and accident, and other personal insurance.
• The commercial segment includes casualty (e.g., liability, workers’ compensation), property, specialty (e.g., crop, marine, political risk), and financial (e.g., errors and omissions, fiduciary liability) insurance.

Disclosure Topic: Policies Designed to Incentivize Responsible Behavior
Accounting Metric: Discussion of products and/or product features that incentivize health, safety, and/or environmentally responsible actions and/or behaviors
Technical Protocol: Disclosure shall include a description of the aspects of traditional products that incentivize health, safety, and/or environmentally responsible actions or behavior. Such aspects include, but are not limited to:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Premium discounts for green buildings
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Premium discounts for improving resource efficiency of properties
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Actuarially adjusted premiums for the use of low-emission vehicles, fuel-efficient non-hybrid vehicles, or alternative-fuel vehicles
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: Premium discounts for safer driving and lower use of personal vehicles
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 5: Premium discounts for healthy behavior (healthy diet, routine exercise, weight loss, giving up smoking/drinking)

Disclosure Topic: Policies Designed to Incentivize Responsible Behavior
Accounting Metric: Discussion of products and/or product features that incentivize health, safety, and/or environmentally responsible actions and/or behaviors
Technical Protocol: The entity may disclose quantitative measures related to performance on underwriting of products with clauses incentivizing healthy, safe, and/or environmentally responsible actions or behavior such as:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Number of policies incorporating such clauses
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Amount of premiums generated from the relevant products
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Quantitative measures of the associated social and environmental factors influenced through products (i.e., reduction in the amount of car accidents involving policyholders, amount of exercise hours per week, average amount of weight lost by a policyholder)

Accounting Metric: Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from weather-related natural catastrophes
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from natural peril catastrophe events.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: PML is defined as the anticipated value of the largest monetary loss affecting the entity's insurance portfolio that could result from weather-related natural catastrophes and is based on catastrophe modeling and exceedance probability (EP).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The scope of disclosure by a natural peril catastrophe event includes: hurricanes (typhoons), tornadoes, tsunamis, floods, droughts, extreme heat, and winter weather.

Accounting Metric: Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from weather-related natural catastrophes
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the PML using, at a minimum, three likelihood of exceedance scenarios: (1) 2% (1-in-50); (2) 1% (1-in-100); (3) 0.4% (1-in-250).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The entity may disclose additional likelihood of exceedance scenarios.

Accounting Metric: Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from weather-related natural catastrophes
Technical Protocol: The entity shall provide the PML breakdown by geographic location.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Geographic location breakdown shall be aligned with that required by the Regulation S-K item 101(d).

Accounting Metric: Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from weather-related natural catastrophes
Technical Protocol: The entity shall report the PML amount on gross and net of catastrophe reinsurance bases.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The gross PML is the gross probable maximum loss for natural peril catastrophe events (prior to reinsurance) for annual aggregate exposure to all risks, including reinstatement premiums for the year following the relevant year based upon the entity's catastrophe model.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The net PML is the net probable maximum loss for natural peril catastrophe events (after reinsurance) for annual aggregate exposure to all risks, including reinstatement premiums for the year following the relevant year based upon the entity's catastrophe model.

Accounting Metric: Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from weather-related natural catastrophes
Technical Protocol: Disclosure shall be provided for relevant geographic regions.

Accounting Metric: Probable Maximum Loss (PML) of insured products from weather-related natural catastrophes
Technical Protocol: The entity may summarize the breakdown of the PML in the following table:

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the amount of policyholder benefits paid and claims incurred during the reporting period as a result of incurred policy losses and benefits expenses related to modeled and non-modeled natural peril catastrophe events.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of disclosure by a natural peril catastrophe event includes: hurricanes (typhoons), tornadoes, tsunamis, floods, droughts, extreme heat, and winter weather.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: Benefits and claims incurred shall be disclosed in accordance with the Financial Accounting Standards Board’s (FASB) Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) Topic 944 Financial Services – Insurance.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall break down the policy losses and benefits expenses for modeled and non-modeled natural peril catastrophe events.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Modeled natural catastrophes are typically large-scale events, such as hurricanes and earthquakes, that the entity has analyzed using a catastrophic risk model.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Non-modeled events are typically smaller-scale events, such as floods, droughts, snowstorms, and tornados, that the entity has not analyzed using a catastrophic model (CAT model).
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 2: • CAT models are probabilistic mathematical models that simulate hazardous events and estimate the associated potential damages and insured losses. They may be conducted by the entity or by a third party on behalf of the entity.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall break down the policy losses and benefits expenses by geographic segment.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall break down the policy losses and benefits expenses by natural peril catastrophe events.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Where relevant, natural peril catastrophe events include: hurricanes (typhoons), tornadoes, tsunamis, floods, droughts, extreme heat, and winter weather.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall report the policy losses and benefits expenses on a gross and net of catastrophe reinsurance base.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The net amount shall be calculated as the gross amount of policy losses and benefits expenses from natural peril catastrophe events minus the recoverables from ceded reinsurance.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses attributable to insurance payouts from (1) modeled natural catastrophes and (2) non-modeled natural catastrophes, by type of event and geographic segment (net and gross of reinsurance)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall consider the FASB’s ASC Topic 944 – Financial Services – Insurance a normative reference, thus any future updates made to it shall be considered updates to this guidance.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its approach to incorporation of environmental risks into both individual policyholder contracts and enterprise-wide assessments of risk.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe the processes for identifying and assessing climate-related risks on insurance and reinsurance portfolios by geography, business division, or product segments.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Climate-related risks are defined by the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) as:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Physical risks from changing frequencies and intensities of weather-related perils
• Transition risks resulting from a reduction in insurable interest due to a decline in value, changing energy costs, or implementation of carbon regulation
• Liability risks that could intensify due to a possible increase in litigation

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe what it considers to be the relevant short-, medium-, and long-term horizons in the context of underwriting process for individual contracts as well as the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe specific climate-related risks for each time horizon (short, medium, and long term) that the entity considers in the underwriting process for individual contracts as well as in the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe the process for integration of climate-related risks in probabilistic mathematical models (i.e., catastrophic models).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• The use of new and emerging datasets (e.g., for dam burst risk)
• The use of the critical input parameters, assumptions and considerations, and analytical choices
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Discussion shall be provided in the context of the relevant short-, medium-, and long-term horizons.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe how outputs of catastrophe models inform its underwriting decisions.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Development of insurance and reinsurance products which take into account climate-related risks
• Pricing of insurance and reinsurance policies
• Client selection (i.e., type of events the entity chooses to cover or not and/or geographic markets in which the entity chooses not to underwrite policies)
• Cedent selection (i.e., decisions on the amount of risk the entity chooses to transfer through reinsurance)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Discussion shall be provided in the context of the relevant short-, medium-, and long-term horizons.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe the process for incorporation of clauses in the insurance policies sold to clients that incentivize reduction of exposure to climate-related risks of insured assets through pricing structure of the policies.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to, incentives such as:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• The use of sustainable building materials
• Enhancement of the weather resiliency of properties
• Coverage of properties in communities with building codes requiring climate-risk adaptations

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss the process for integration of environmental risks into enterprise-wide assessments.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Consideration of risks by segment (e.g., life versus property and casualty)
• Capital adequacy
• Contingency planning for market failure (i.e., from numerous disaster-related claims)
• Use of alternative risk transfer (e.g., catastrophe bonds, weather derivatives)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Discussion shall be provided in the context of the relevant short-, medium-, and long-term horizons.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental risks into (1) the underwriting process for individual contracts and (2) the management of firm-level risks and capital adequacy
Technical Protocol: The entity may discuss how sustainability risks are integrated into its use of an enterprise risk management (ERM) framework, such as the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) Enterprise Risk Management–Integrated Framework.

Accounting Metric: Exposure to derivative instruments by category: (1) total potential exposure to non-centrally cleared derivatives, (2) total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse, and (3) total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose its exposure to all derivatives, regardless of maturity date, as reported on the entity’s Schedule DB – Part D filed with the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) for the following categories: (1) total potential exposure to non-centrally Cleared Derivatives, (2) total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse, and (3) total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Non-centrally cleared derivatives are defined as derivatives that are not cleared through a central counterparty.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Centrally cleared derivatives are defined as derivatives that are cleared through a central counterparty.

Accounting Metric: Exposure to derivative instruments by category: (1) total potential exposure to non-centrally cleared derivatives, (2) total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse, and (3) total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives
Technical Protocol: Total potential exposure to non-centrally cleared derivatives shall be disclosed as the sum of totals for each of the NAIC Designations, as reported on the Schedule DB – Part D, Column 11.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The amount shall exclude the value reported on Line 0899999 Aggregate Sum of Central Clearinghouse.

Accounting Metric: Exposure to derivative instruments by category: (1) total potential exposure to non-centrally cleared derivatives, (2) total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse, and (3) total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives
Technical Protocol: Total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse shall include the amount reported in Line 0899999 Aggregate Sum of Central Clearinghouse, as reported on the Schedule DB – Part D, Column 4.

Accounting Metric: Exposure to derivative instruments by category: (1) total potential exposure to non-centrally cleared derivatives, (2) total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse, and (3) total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives
Technical Protocol: Total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives shall include the amount reported in Line 0899999 Aggregate Sum of Central Clearinghouse, as reported on the Schedule DB – Part D, Column 11.

Accounting Metric: Exposure to derivative instruments by category: (1) total potential exposure to non-centrally cleared derivatives, (2) total fair value of acceptable collateral posted with the Central Clearinghouse, and (3) total potential exposure to centrally cleared derivatives
Technical Protocol: The entity shall use the instruction for Schedule DB to calculate the amount of exposure to derivatives.

Accounting Metric: Total fair value of securities lending collateral assets
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the total fair value of securities lending reinvested collateral assets, regardless of maturity date.

Accounting Metric: Total fair value of securities lending collateral assets
Technical Protocol: The entity shall calculate the total fair value as the sum of (1) the fair value of reinvested collateral assets reported on the entity’s Schedule DL – Part 1, filed with the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) and (2) the fair value of reinvested collateral assets reported on the entity’s Schedule DL – Part 2, filed with the NAIC.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The fair value of the reinvested collateral assets reported on the entity’s Schedule DL – Part 1 is that reported on Line 9999999 in Column 5 of the Schedule.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The fair value of the reinvested collateral assets reported on the entity’s Schedule DL – Part 2 is that reported on Line 9999999 in Column 5 of the Schedule.

Accounting Metric: Total fair value of securities lending collateral assets
Technical Protocol: The entity shall use the instruction for Schedule DL to calculate the fair value of its securities lending collateral assets.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to managing capital- and liquidity-related risks associated with systemic non-insurance activities
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its approach to managing capital- and liquidity-related risks associated with the entity’s engagement in systemic non-insurance activities.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Systemic non-insurance activities are defined as investment and funding or other capital market activities that result in maturity or liquidity transformation, leverage or imperfect transfer of credit risk, such as repo and securities lending or the writing of derivatives contracts that are not used to hedge risk or do not closely match the underlying exposure.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to managing capital- and liquidity-related risks associated with systemic non-insurance activities
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include activities of all parts of the entity’s insurance group including non-insurance entities (regulated or unregulated) and partly owned entities.

Accounting Metric: Description of approach to managing capital- and liquidity-related risks associated with systemic non-insurance activities
Technical Protocol: The discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The entity’s risk management policy adopted as a result of compliance with regulatory frameworks as well as voluntarily as the industry best practice
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The entity’s stress testing as well as contingency planning for stressed situations
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: The entity’s liquidity and responsiveness to sudden market movements
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: Responsiveness of the entity’s enterprise risk management (ERM) framework and risk management policy to change as a result of both internal and external events
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 5: Liquidity risk arising from:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 5:
• Changes in value and liquidity of collateral received in securities lending activities
• Investment of collateral in other (illiquid) assets
• Mark to market changes in value of underlying instrument
• Collateral calls on derivatives contracts
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 6: The entity’s approach to management of its potential exposure to centrally cleared and non-centrally cleared derivatives.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of residential mortgages of the following types: (a) Hybrid or Option Adjustable-rate Mortgages (ARM), (b) Prepayment Penalty, (c) Higher Rate, (d) Total, by FICO scores above or below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the (1) number and (2) value of residential mortgage loans held in the entity's portfolio of the following type: (a) Hybrid or Option Adjustable-rate mortgages (ARM), (b) Prepayment Penalty, (c) Higher Rate, (d) Total; each broken down by FICO score range: (i) below, or equal to, 660 and (ii) above 660.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Hybrid or option adjustable-rate mortgages (ARMs) are defined as mortgages with interest rate resets of less than five years, negative amortization, and/or interest-only payment schedules.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Higher-rate mortgages are defined as those that are at least 300 basis points above treasuries of comparable maturity.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Prepayment penalties are defined as mortgage contracts that include a clause that assesses a penalty if the mortgage is paid in full within a certain time period.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of residential mortgages of the following types: (a) Hybrid or Option Adjustable-rate Mortgages (ARM), (b) Prepayment Penalty, (c) Higher Rate, (d) Total, by FICO scores above or below 660
Technical Protocol: The number of mortgages shall include the absolute number of first mortgages (1-4 family) and junior lien (1-4 family second mortgages or home equity lines of credit) loans that the entity holds as loan assets.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of residential mortgages of the following types: (a) Hybrid or Option Adjustable-rate Mortgages (ARM), (b) Prepayment Penalty, (c) Higher Rate, (d) Total, by FICO scores above or below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity may summarize the disclosure in the following table:

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of (a) residential mortgage modifications, (b) foreclosures, and (c) short sales or deeds in lieu of foreclosure, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the (1) number and (2) value of (a) modifications, (b) foreclosures, (c) short sales or deeds in lieu of foreclosure held in the entity's portfolio of first mortgages (1-4 family) and junior lien (1-4 family second mortgages or home equity lines of credit) loans during the reporting period broken down by FICO score range: (i) below, or equal to, 660 and (ii) above 660.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Modifications are defined as mortgages where one or more of the following was changed from the original terms: the principal amount, the payment amount, the length of the term of the loan, the interest rate (e.g., the rate was lowered or changed from a floating to a fixed rate), or the assessment of fees or penalties.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Foreclosures are defined as those instances when a borrower has defaulted on a mortgage and sale of the underlying property asset is forced, through legal or statutory means.
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 2: • The scope of disclosure shall include consumer real estate assets that entered foreclosure during the reporting period, regardless of whether they were sold or held for sale.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Short sales are defined as transactions in which the entity agrees to accept less than the full amount of the debt owed by the borrower and releases its lien on the asset.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: A deed in lieu of sale is defined as a property asset for which the borrower conveys all interest to the entity to satisfy a mortgage loan that is in default and avoid foreclosure.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of (a) residential mortgage modifications, (b) foreclosures, and (c) short sales or deeds in lieu of foreclosure, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity may disclose the number and value of principal reduction modifications, as defined by the U.S. Federal Housing Finance Agency, included in the number and value of total modifications.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of (a) residential mortgage modifications, (b) foreclosures, and (c) short sales or deeds in lieu of foreclosure, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity may summarize the disclosure in the following table:

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with communications to customers or remuneration of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the total amount of monetary losses it incurred during the reporting period as a result of legal proceedings associated with communications to customers or remuneration of loan originators.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with communications to customers or remuneration of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The legal proceedings shall include any adjudicative proceeding in which the entity was involved, whether before a court, a regulator, an arbitrator, or otherwise.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with communications to customers or remuneration of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The losses shall include all monetary liabilities to the opposing party or to others (whether as the result of settlement or verdict after trial or otherwise), including fines and other monetary liabilities incurred during the reporting period as a result of civil actions (e.g., civil judgments or settlements), regulatory proceedings (e.g., penalties, disgorgement, or restitution), and criminal actions (e.g., criminal judgment, penalties, or restitution) brought by any entity (e.g., governmental, business, or individual).

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with communications to customers or remuneration of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The scope of monetary losses shall exclude legal and other fees and expenses incurred by the entity in its defense.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with communications to customers or remuneration of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include, but is not limited to, legal proceedings associated with enforcement of relevant industry regulations, such as:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The Regulation Z (Truth in Lending Act) provisions relating to disclosure communications to customers and remuneration of loan originators, including Subpart D and Subpart E
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The EU Guidelines on sound remuneration policies under Articles 74(3) and 75(2) of Directive 2013/36/EU and disclosures under Article 450 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013

Accounting Metric: Description of remuneration structure of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose how the remuneration of loan officers relates to the terms and conditions of loans, such as the size of the mortgage loan, interest rates, up-front points or fees, or the ability of the loan to be securitized.

Accounting Metric: Description of remuneration structure of loan originators
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe relevant aspects of the remuneration structure, including the use of bonuses, commissions, pooled compensation, profit-sharing, or other financial incentives for loan originators, officers, or brokers.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The entity shall consider remuneration provided directly to the loan originator from a consumer to be within the scope of disclosure.

Accounting Metric: Description of remuneration structure of loan originators
Technical Protocol: Discussion shall include, but is not limited to:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The regulatory environment regarding employee remuneration in which entity operates and whether it is required to have certain remuneration policies in place, where the entity shall discuss whether remuneration policies it has are the result of entity requirement or are adopted voluntarily as the industry best practice
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The performance objectives for the institution, business areas, and staff
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: The methods for the measurement of performance, including the performance criteria
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: The structure of variable remuneration, including where applicable the instruments in which parts of the variable remuneration are awarded

Accounting Metric: Description of remuneration structure of loan originators
Technical Protocol: Loan originators are defined per the U.S. Federal Reserve‘s Regulation Z as persons who, for compensation or other monetary gain, or in expectation of compensation or other monetary gain, arranges, negotiates, or otherwise obtains an extension of consumer credit for another person.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of disclosure includes the entity’s employees involved in origination of residential and commercial mortgage and home equity loans.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number, (2) value, and (3) weighted average Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of mortgages issued to (a) minority and (b) all other borrowers, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the (1) number, (2) value, and (3) weighted average Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of mortgage loans held in the entity's portfolio that are issued to (a) minority and (b) all other borrowers, each broken down by FICO score range: (i) below, or equal to, 660 and (ii) above 660.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Minority is defined according to the U.S. Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC) as: (1) all races other than White and (2) Whites of Hispanic or Latino origin.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: For mortgage applications where applicants are of one or more race or ethnicity and/or for applicants where there are joint applicants of different races or ethnic groups, the entity shall follow the categorization process used in the FFIEC’s Guide to Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) Reporting.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: LTV shall be consistent with the FDIC definition found in Part 365 “REAL ESTATE LENDING STANDARDS” of Rules and Regulations and is calculated as a “percentage that is derived at the time of loan origination by dividing an extension of credit by the total value of the property(ies) securing or being improved by the extension of credit plus the amount of any readily marketable collateral and other acceptable collateral that secures the extension of credit. The total amount of all senior liens on or interests in such property(ies) should be included in determining the LTV ratio. When mortgage insurance or collateral is used in the calculation of the loan-to-value ratio, and such credit enhancement is later released or replaced, the loan-to-value ratio should be recalculated."
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: The entity shall calculate the weighted average LTV by weighting each LTV by the respective loan amount, and then dividing the sum of the weighted LTVs by the total loan amount.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number, (2) value, and (3) weighted average Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of mortgages issued to (a) minority and (b) all other borrowers, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: Race and ethnicity categories shall be based upon the FFIEC’s Guide to HMDA Reporting but classification shall be done by self-identification (e.g., during the application process).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Race categories include: American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, and White.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Ethnicity categories include: “Hispanic or Latino” and “Not Hispanic or Latino.”

Accounting Metric: (1) Number, (2) value, and (3) weighted average Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of mortgages issued to (a) minority and (b) all other borrowers, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure includes first mortgages (1-4 family) and junior lien (1-4 family second mortgages or home equity lines of credit) loans that the entity held in its portfolio as the end of the reporting period, including those originated and purchased by the entity.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number, (2) value, and (3) weighted average Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of mortgages issued to (a) minority and (b) all other borrowers, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure includes mortgages issued in the U.S.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number, (2) value, and (3) weighted average Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of mortgages issued to (a) minority and (b) all other borrowers, by FICO scores above and below 660
Technical Protocol: The entity may summarize the disclosure in the following table:

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with discriminatory mortgage lending
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the total amount of monetary losses it incurred during the reporting period as a result of legal proceedings associated with actual or alleged discriminatory mortgage lending.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with discriminatory mortgage lending
Technical Protocol: The legal proceedings shall include any adjudicative proceeding in which the entity was involved, whether before a court, a regulator, an arbitrator, or otherwise.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with discriminatory mortgage lending
Technical Protocol: The losses shall include all monetary liabilities to the opposing party or to others (whether as the result of settlement or verdict after trial or otherwise), including fines and other monetary liabilities incurred during the reporting period as a result of civil actions (e.g., civil judgments or settlements), regulatory proceedings (e.g., penalties, disgorgement, or restitution), and criminal actions (e.g., criminal judgment, penalties, or restitution) brought by any entity (e.g., governmental, business, or individual).

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with discriminatory mortgage lending
Technical Protocol: The scope of monetary losses shall exclude legal and other fees and expenses incurred by the entity in its defense.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with discriminatory mortgage lending
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include, but is not limited to, legal proceedings associated with enforcement of non-discriminatory lending provisions of the U.S. Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA), the U.S. Fair Housing Act (FHA), and non-U.S. equivalents.

Accounting Metric: Description of policies and procedures for ensuring nondiscriminatory mortgage origination
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe relevant policies and procedures that ensure non-discriminatory mortgage origination resulting in comparable terms and conditions of loans, including the size of the mortgage, interest rates, discount points, or fees.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Discriminatory mortgage origination is defined according to the U.S. Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA) which makes it unlawful to discriminate (1) on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, or age; (2) because all or part of the applicant’s income derives from any public assistance program; or (3) because the applicant has in good faith exercised any right under the U.S. Consumer Credit Protection Act (CCPA).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The scope of discussion includes, but is not limited to, how the entity ensures compliance with the ECOA, the Fair Housing Act (FHA), or non-U.S. equivalents.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Discount points are defined as fees paid directly to the lender at closing in exchange for a reduced interest rate.

Accounting Metric: Description of policies and procedures for ensuring nondiscriminatory mortgage origination
Technical Protocol: Relevant policies and procedures include, but are not limited to:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Internal Controls, such as ensuring adequate training of originators, processors, underwriters, and collection personnel, adequate documentation and recordkeeping
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Monitoring of Loan Portfolio on Race, Gender, Ethnicity, and other factors
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Disclosures to Borrowers

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgage loans in 100-year flood zones
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the (1) number and (2) value of mortgage loans in the entity’s portfolio underwritten on properties that are located in 100-year flood zones.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: 100-year flood zones are defined as land areas subject to a one-percent or greater chance of flooding in any given year. Such areas may also be referred to as being subject to the one-percent annual chance flood, the one-percent annual exceedance probability flood, or the 100-year flood.
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1: • Examples of 100-year flood zones may include, but are not limited to, coastal flood plains, flood plains along major rivers, and areas subject to flooding from ponding in low-lying areas.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: For mortgage loans on properties located in the U.S., 100-year flood zones shall include those land areas designated by the U.S. Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) as special flood hazard areas (SFHA).
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 2:
• SFHAs are defined as land area in the flood plain subject to a one-percent or greater chance of flooding in any given year. The area may be designated in the applicable flood insurance rate map, as per the U.S. National Flood Insurance Program, as Zones A, AO, AH, A1-30, AE, A99, AR, AR/A1-30, AR/AE, AR/AO, AR/AH, AR/A, VO, V1-30, VE, and V. This definition is derived from U.S. 44 CFR 59.1.
• The entity may disclose its risk perception and potential impacts resulting from reclassification of FEMA SFHAs, including the risk of expansion of such areas into real estate property covered by mortgages owned by the entity.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: For mortgage loans on properties located in Canada, the entity may refer to Canada’s Provincial/Territorial Flood Damage Reduction Programs.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: For mortgage loans on properties located in the EU, the entity may refer to the EU’s Flood Directive.

Accounting Metric: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgage loans in 100-year flood zones
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include all of the entity’s mortgage loans underwritten on properties that are located in 100-year flood zones, regardless of the country of their location.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of mortgage loans shall include those first mortgages (1-4 family) and junior lien (1-4 family second mortgages or home equity lines of credit) loans that the entity holds as loan assets.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The scope of mortgage loans shall exclude mortgages held for sale, mortgage-backed securities, and mortgages serviced by the entity.

Accounting Metric: (1) Total expected loss and (2) Loss Given Default (LGD) attributable to mortgage loan default and delinquency due to weather-related natural catastrophes, by geographic region
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the (1) total expected loss and (2) Loss Given Default (LGD), as a percentage, attributable to mortgage loan default and delinquency due to weather-related natural catastrophes.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Expected loss is defined and calculated as the sum of the values of all the possible losses for the entity’s mortgage loans, each multiplied by the probability of that loss occurring.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: LGD is defined as the share of an asset lost in the situation of default.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Weather-related natural catastrophes include:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 3:
• Meteorological events (e.g., hurricanes and storms)
• Hydrological events (floods)
• Climatological events (e.g., heat waves, cold waves, droughts, and wildfires)
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: Weather-related natural catastrophes exclude geophysical events (e.g., earthquakes and volcanic eruptions)

Accounting Metric: (1) Total expected loss and (2) Loss Given Default (LGD) attributable to mortgage loan default and delinquency due to weather-related natural catastrophes, by geographic region
Technical Protocol: The entity shall break down its disclosure by geographic region.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Applicable regions are determined by the entity, and may include: Gulf Coast, California, Northeast, Mountain, Midwest.

Accounting Metric: Description of how climate change and other environmental risks are incorporated into mortgage origination and underwriting
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe how it has incorporated climate change and other environmental risks into its mortgage origination and underwriting processes.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The mortgage origination process is defined broadly as all the steps in a mortgage transaction between a lender and a borrower, including, but not limited to, application, processing, and underwriting.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The scope of climate change and other environmental risks includes, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 2:
• The increased frequency and severity of weather-related natural catastrophes, including meteorological events (e.g., hurricanes and storms), hydrological events (floods), and climatological events (e.g., heat waves, cold waves, droughts, and wildfires).
• The occurrence of geophysical events (e.g., earthquakes and volcanic eruptions).

Accounting Metric: Description of how climate change and other environmental risks are incorporated into mortgage origination and underwriting
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose how and if these risks affect its origination models and decisions.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of disclosure includes, but is not limited to:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• How the risk impacts the valuation of collateral, such as accounting for inherent risks due to location or assessing for the implementation of basic adaptive measures (e.g., reinforcement, hurricane shutters).
• How natural disaster risks affect credit risk analysis, including if the entity assumes that increases in natural disaster frequency and severity will increase the likelihood of default due to properties being un-insured or under-insured.

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe its oversight of clinical research organizations’ (CROs’) quality and safety systems, such as the type of procedures followed, use and frequency of audits or inspections, and enforcement mechanisms.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: A clinical research organization or contract research organization (CRO) is a scientific organization (commercial, academic or other) to which the entity has transferred some of its tasks and obligations as a sponsor.

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss its management process for CROs, broken down by the following world regions: North America, Central and Latin America, Asia (including the Middle East), and Africa.

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The entity may describe the nature and terms of monetary incentives that it uses or that are used by the CROs with which it contracts.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Reimbursements for meal, travel, or lodging are excluded from the scope of the discussion.

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The entity shall describe the process for obtaining informed consent from participants in clinical trials.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: As outlined by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, informed consent requires more than legally effective acceptance of participation in a clinical trial. It also involves, on the part of the entity:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Disclosing to potential research subjects information needed to make an informed decision
• Facilitating the understanding of what has been disclosed
• Promoting the voluntariness of the decision about whether or not to participate in the research

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The entity shall list all clinical trials, conducted by the entity (including those outsourced to third parties such as CROs), that were terminated for failure to follow good clinical practice (GCP) standards.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Good Clinical Practice (GCP) standards are defined and regulated by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration and through international GCP guidance that has been adopted by the FDA.

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The entity shall list all clinical trials terminated, whether the decision was made by investigator(s) or the study sponsor, and whether it was made with or without the input of a data monitoring committee (DMC).

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: Disclosure should not include clinical trials terminated for reasons other than those related to GCP, such as reallocation of funding, loss of personnel, failure to meet study benchmarks, or lack of participants.

Accounting Metric: Discussion, by world region, of management process for ensuring quality and patient safety during clinical trials
Technical Protocol: The scope of the disclosure includes the entity’s management process with respect to all CROs it has worked with during the past reporting period or with which it has worked with in the past and plans to work with in the future.

Accounting Metric: Number of FDA Sponsor Inspections related to clinical trial management and pharmacovigilance that resulted in: (1) Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI) and (2) Official Action Indicated (OAI)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose inspections of investigators that conducted clinical trials for the entity or on behalf of the entity (such as at a clinical research organization (CRO)).

Accounting Metric: Number of FDA Sponsor Inspections related to clinical trial management and pharmacovigilance that resulted in: (1) Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI) and (2) Official Action Indicated (OAI)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the number of inspections related to its own clinical trials that resulted in a classification of Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI) or Official Action Indicated (OAI).
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The entity may access the publicly available Clinical Investigator Inspection Search.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The entity may search the database for inspections of investigators that they have used for clinical trials during the reporting period. The FDA’s Clinical Investigator Inspection List (CLIIL) is organized by individual investigators (i.e., individual persons at research locations); however, a search can be conducted by “location” for the name—or variations of the name—of the entity’s facilities or clinical research organizations (CROs) it uses.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: The results of the inspection are listed in the “Classification” column.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in developing countries
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the total amount of monetary losses it incurred during the reporting period as a result of legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in developing countries.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The scope of the disclosure shall include, but is not limited to, legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in countries that meet the criteria established by the most recent Access to Medicine Index Methodology, including:
Sub-Bullet Points for Bullet Point 1:
• Low-income as defined by the World Bank income classifications
• Lower-middle-income as defined by the World Bank income classifications
• Least developed country as defined by the UN Committee for Development Policy
• Low or medium human development country as defined by the UN Human Development Index
• All countries that receive a score of less than 0.6 on the UN Inequality-Adjusted Human Development Index
• All least developed countries as defined by the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC)

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in developing countries
Technical Protocol: The legal proceedings shall include any adjudicative proceeding in which the entity was involved, whether before a court, a regulator, an arbitrator, or otherwise.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in developing countries
Technical Protocol: The losses shall include all monetary liabilities to the opposing party or to others (whether as the result of settlement or verdict after trial or otherwise), including fines and other monetary liabilities incurred during the reporting period as a result of civil actions (e.g., civil judgments or settlements), regulatory proceedings (e.g., penalties, disgorgement, or restitution), and criminal actions (e.g., criminal judgment, penalties, or restitution) brought by any entity (e.g., governmental, business, or individual).

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in developing countries
Technical Protocol: The scope of monetary losses shall exclude legal and other fees and expenses incurred by the entity in its defense.

Accounting Metric: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with clinical trials in developing countries
Technical Protocol: The scope of disclosure shall include, but is not limited to, legal proceedings associated with the enforcement of relevant industry regulations promulgated by regional, federal, state, and local regulatory authorities, such as the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose initiatives launched, funded, supported, or otherwise participated in during the reporting period that related to improving access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries.

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss products authorized for sale and available during the reporting period.

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: The entity shall discuss initiatives if implementation was ongoing during the reporting period. Initiatives that began or concluded during the reporting period may be discussed; the entity, however, should indicate this condition.

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: The entity may describe the following issues as they relate to access to health care initiatives:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Research and development
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Pricing
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Public policy and market influence efforts
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: Manufacturing and distribution
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 5: Patents and licensing
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 6: Product donations
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 7: Philanthropic activities

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: The Access to Medicine Foundation considers the priority issues and diseases in priority countries to be those with the highest Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) based on World Health Organization (WHO) data. These include communicable diseases, non-communicable diseases, neglected tropical diseases, maternal and neonatal health conditions, and priority pathogens. A full list is included in the most recent Access to Medicine Index Methodology.

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: Disclosure shall focus on initiatives related to the aforementioned diseases, conditions, and pathogens.

Accounting Metric: Description of actions and initiatives to promote access to health care products for priority diseases and in priority countries as defined by the Access to Medicine Index
Technical Protocol: The entity may discuss additional or alternative diseases, conditions, and pathogens but should provide evidence that they are considered a priority in the priority countries discussed.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Priority countries comprise those that are defined and identified in the most recent Access to Medicine Index Methodology.

Accounting Metric: List of products on the WHO List of Prequalified Medicinal Products as part of its Prequalification of Medicines Programme (PQP)
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose a list of its products authorized for sale and available during the reporting period that are on the World Health Organization (WHO) List of Prequalified Medicinal Products.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Multiple listings of the same active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) in different strengths (e.g., 30 mg and 20 mg) or in different formulations (e.g., tablet and capsule) shall be counted once.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: Listings of single APIs (e.g., Lamivudine) and combinations of the same API with one or more additional APIs (e.g., Lamivudine + Stavudine) shall be counted separately but follow guidance for multiple strengths and formulations.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Products listed under the status “Suspended” shall not be counted.

Accounting Metric: List of products on the WHO List of Prequalified Medicinal Products as part of its Prequalification of Medicines Programme (PQP)
Technical Protocol: The list of products should be provided by International Nonproprietary Name (INN), including brand name(s) in parentheses where applicable.

Accounting Metric: List of products on the WHO List of Prequalified Medicinal Products as part of its Prequalification of Medicines Programme (PQP)
Technical Protocol: The entity may disclose the number of its products targeting each WHO-defined therapeutic area, including, but not limited to:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: Diarrhea
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: HIV/AIDS
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 3: Influenza
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 4: Malaria
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 5: Reproductive health

Accounting Metric: List of products on the WHO List of Prequalified Medicinal Products as part of its Prequalification of Medicines Programme (PQP)
Technical Protocol: Initiatives involving products targeting WHO-defined therapeutic areas shall be discussed if implementation was ongoing during the reporting period.

Accounting Metric: Number of settlements of Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) litigation that involved payments and/or provisions to delay bringing an authorized generic product to market for a defined time period
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose all instances in which it entered into settlement relating to a challenge of one of its patents under the Paragraph IV-certified Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) process established under the Drug Price Competition and Patent Term Restoration Act (the “Hatch-Waxman Act”) and in which that settlement involved compensation for the generic challenger and/or an agreement on behalf of the generic challenger to delay entry to the market of a generic bioequivalent.

Accounting Metric: Number of settlements of Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) litigation that involved payments and/or provisions to delay bringing an authorized generic product to market for a defined time period
Technical Protocol: Payments include direct monetary settlement paid to a generic manufacturer as well as forms of implicit compensation, such as reduced royalty payment for delayed market entry or agreement by the entity not to introduce its own authorized generic (AG) during the 180-day “first filer” period.

Accounting Metric: Number of settlements of Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) litigation that involved payments and/or provisions to delay bringing an authorized generic product to market for a defined time period
Technical Protocol: The entity should indicate if it entered multiple settlements for the same product.

Accounting Metric: Percentage change in: (1) average list price and (2) average net price across U.S. product portfolio compared to previous year
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the average list price increase across all the entity’s pharmaceutical products sold in the U.S. during the reporting period, where:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The annual average list price increase shall be calculated as percent change versus the prior year for each product weighted by list price across the entity’s U.S. portfolio of pharmaceutical products.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The list price shall represent the average wholesale acquisition cost (WAC) and shall represent the average WAC for the year in which it is being calculated.

Accounting Metric: Percentage change in: (1) average list price and (2) average net price across U.S. product portfolio compared to previous year
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the average net price increase across all the entity’s pharmaceutical products sold in the U.S. during the reporting period, where:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The annual average net price increase shall be calculated as percent change versus the prior year and for each product weighted by list price across the entity’s U.S. portfolio of pharmaceutical products.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The net price shall represent the average wholesale acquisition cost (WAC) minus rebates, discounts, and returns and shall represent the average WAC minus rebates, discounts, and returns for the year in which it is being calculated.

Accounting Metric: Percentage change in: (1) list price and (2) net price of product with largest increase compared to previous year
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the percent change in list price and the name of the product with the largest increase in list price compared to previous year, where:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The change in net price increase shall be calculated as the percent change in price between the current and prior year for an individual product.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: List price should represent the average wholesale acquisition cost (WAC) for the specific product and shall represent the average WAC for the year in which it is being calculated.

Accounting Metric: Percentage change in: (1) list price and (2) net price of product with largest increase compared to previous year
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose the percent change in net price and the name of the product with the largest increase in net price compared to previous year, where:
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 1: The change in net price increase should be calculated as percent change in price between the current and prior year for an individual product.
Technical Protocol Bullet Point 2: The net price shall represent the average wholesale acquisition cost (WAC) minus rebates, discounts, and returns for the specific product and shall represent the average WAC minus rebates, discounts, and returns for the year in which it is being calculated.

Accounting Metric: List of products listed in the Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) MedWatch Safety Alerts for Human Medical Products database
Technical Protocol: The entity shall disclose all drugs and therapeutic biological products associated with the entity that are listed in the Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) MedWatch Safety Alerts for Human Medical Products database.
